copyright.approverComments: Distribution within the U.S. granted by agreement

abstract: Ocean ice interaction processes in the Marginal Ice Zone (MIZ) by wind, waves, and mesoscale features, such as upwelling and eddies, are studied using ERS-1 Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images and ocean ice interaction model. A sequence of SAR images of the Chukchi Sea MIZ with three days interval are studied for ice edge advance/retreat. Simultaneous current measurements from the northeast Chukchi Sea as well as the Barrow wind record are used to interpret the MIZ dynamics.
title: Ocean-ice interaction in the marginal ice zone

publications.publicationName: ESA, Proceedings of the Second ERS-1 Symposium on Space at the Service of Our Environment, Volume 1

related.title: Seventh Annual Workshop on Space Operations Applications and Research (SOAR 1993), volume 1
